section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r July 31. 91.

addressleaf.section:
Belgia. 1591 31 July To my L Trea
s

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
good L. to be advertised, that after the writing of
my last w
ch
I sent from
Arnham,
the 24 of this moneth, I
was constrayned, for some urgent occasyon on my private state
to make a stepp into
e Hage, whertoo
e opportunitye did serve mee
very fitly. O
r
army lyeng still, w
th
out p
nt
apparance of any
enterprise toward
, wherby her
Ma
ty
might have wanted any
te of
my service. Howbeit I am ready to returne, assone as I shall
learne, where
e
Councel
will resyde, at theyr next removall. For
as they have written to this place, they have certaine intelligence that
e
Duke of Parma
is passed
e Maese, w
th
a
te of his force
e rest remayning yet at Mouwick a village fast by
Grave
leaving still in
Nieumegen
but
e ordinary garrison. Wheruppon
it is resolved
t
they will p
nt
ly in hand w
th
e siege of
t
Towne. But by reason of much raine; that hath fallen in those
quarters,
e wael is greatly risen &
e transportation of o
r
troupes
in
e places neere to Arnham is found very difficult. It is
therfore thought good to passe over
e army fast by
Tiel,
where
the Country is called between Maese & Wael. w
ch
is a sure place
to encamp & hath all store of provision. There ys certain
advertisement,
t
many of
e chiefest inhabitant
of Nieumegen
will abandon
e towne for feare of o
r
coming, &
t
some are
gon alredy w
th
theyr houshold
& goods. &
e Duke yt is
thought wilbee forced to retourne to succo
r
e place, or els there
is no dout, but we shall cary yt away suddenly.
There is also a brute, & supposed to be trew that wee have
defeated a company of horse of
e Ennemy & taken
e
Rutmaster prisoner, w
ch
was don about
Groll
in
e Country of
Zutphen.
Verdugo
ys retourned toward
Groningen
w
th
200 horse
& many
mises of furder assistance. It is heer reported
by certaine
Amsterdam
shippes, w
ch
come newly out of
Spaine
that there ys lieng at
e Groine a fleet of 40 shippes
w
ch
are ready to be employed in some p
nt
s
vice.
At
e instant sute of
e
French K
.
e states of these Provinces
have yeelded to send him 4 double canons & 4 demy canons.
w
th
pouder & bullet so much as may
s
ve for 4000 shott
but all is w
th
condition, that it shalbee employed to
e siege of
Rouen
& not oth
r
wise, wherof
e K. is to notefy his determinate
purpose. The re ys a speech
t
e D. of Parma hath
given order to rase
e fort of
Rees,
but wee know yt not
assuredly.
Having no other matter of any worth
I take
my humble leave. Hage. Julj 31. 91.
